Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019You really can't track this because people do different things after NS. If I serve National Service and go on to start a successful business because I learnt to work with men from all walks of life, that's a positive financial impact. If I stopped working hard after that because I learnt during my time that you'll get paid no matter what job you do, that's a negative financial impact.  and these two things actually happne.If you're talking about the 2 year difference and we're both teachers - this is a pretty common scenario for at least a 5 to 10 year career in education - the men will likely never catch up unless they were particularly ambitious. This is a fact. The tiny increments from service could never hope to match up against the government increments, additional years of experience actually DOING the job and the much higher likelihood of promotion.Yeap.https://www.facebook.com/luke.ho.541 comment0
